intro: Didymocheton macrostachyus, commonly known as the large-stemmed sand-pear, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
